intro: Sarcanthopsis hansemannii, commonly known as the Hansemann's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers clustered in cyathia. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with succulent leaves that help it store water. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
